changelog.release_notes: Added support for color Pebble models and the Pebble Time Round.

- Added support for Bluetooth Low Energy heart rate monitors like the Wahoo Blue HR. If you pair the Elevation Tracker iOS app with a heart rate monitor, it will display your current, average and maximum heart rate. If you enter your maximum and resting heart rates into the settings, it will also display your time spent in each of four heart rate zones (60-70%, 70-80%, 80-90% and 90-100%). Heart rate monitoring requires iOS 7.	

- Added more data to the Pebble watch interface. You can now press the up and down buttons on a Pebble watch to see two additional screens of data.

data.description: This watch app works with the Elevation Tracker iOS app to track your climbing and descending while you run, hike, bike, ski or perform any activity that involves lots of hills. The iOS app tracks your elevation, speed and distance, heart rate, and generates an elevation profile, and the watch app displays a subset of this data for quick access. Supports Pebble Classic, Pebble Steel, Pebble Time, Pebble Time Steel, Pebble Time Round and Pebble 2.

data.description:
Imagine a map displayed on your wrist.  Pans, zooms, and tracks your location.

Customizable features include the mapping service, date, screen, vibration, connectivity, map labels, distance units, and more.

Top button: backlight;  bottom button: pans map based on watch tilt;  flick/tap: distance;  shake watch: refresh map.  Tracking enabled until map is manually panned.

New: long up button press for your current location address.

Mapping tiles Copyright and courtesy of OpenStreetMap, OpenStreetMap contributors, Google Maps, ESRI ArcGIS, Stamen, Bing, and NOAA. Stamen data by Stamen Design (http://stamen.com); OpenStreetMap (http://openstreetmap.org) mapping tiles under Creative Commons licenses.

See the instructional video for a demonstration of the Maptastic features.

v3.0:
- Redesigned for Pebble Time/Steel/Round.
- Voice dictated responses available on Pebble Time/Steel/Round.
- Contacts with multiple numbers can now have those numbers picked from when adding a Favourite contact.
- Responses now sync as soon as contacts window loads for speed.

- Version checking

- All users MUST also update Android app from Google Play!

- Watchapp UI redesign for improved navigation 
- Sync and persistent storage (responses only) improvements.

v1.6.0: - All users MUST also update watchapp from Settings!

- Option to auto-start the watchapp when an SMS or phone call is received.

data.description:

Send customized pre-set (or 'canned') SMS messages from your Pebble! Perfect for times when you need to reply, but it isn't possible to use your phone.

Responses can also be dictated with the microphone!

Add, edit, delete, import and export your list of responses, then choose from them when you open the watchapp. The last contact you received an SMS or Call from is also displayed.

changelog.release_notes: Customizing the list of organizations by updating the settings on the connected phone will now take effect immediately on your Pebble. Also, if all organizations are turned off while customizing the list of organizations, the first organization will be turned on on your Pebble (you must have at least one organization selected!)

Updated to the latest SDK for Pebble. Due to differences between the old and new SDKs some minor user interface changes were made. The list of organizations can be customized by updating the settings on the connected phone. Minor bug fixes and cosmetic changes.
Added Deutscher Volleyball-Verband (German Volleyball Association)

* Under-the-hood changes to store timer information in resources. This makes the application much smaller, which in-turn allows for more organizations.
* Added NCAA Men.
* Adjusted the timer to take missed seconds into account (Pebble Time seems to miss ticks occasionally).
2.7 - Corrected newly added warmup to be 13:00 (5-4-4).
2.6 - Make + and - function correctly for NERVA Juniors when setting warmup time.
2.5 - Under NERVA Juniors, added 14:00 (6-4-4) warmup timer (good for AAU).
2.4 - Fixed incorrect text during NHIAA "between sets" timer.

Version 2.3: Fixed bug where pause/resume icon was incorrect. *** Version 2.2: Cleaned up the timer pause/resume feature and fixed the pause icon. For NCAA Women's volleyball, fixed the long-press of the down< button to vibrate when starting the Extended Intermission timer. It also doesn't wait for the button to be released. *** Version 2.1: Added pause/resume for the select button while the timer is running. For NCAA Women's volleyball, a long-press of the down button, for starting the "between sets" timer, will start a 10-minute Extended Intermission timer (with 3-minute horn warning) when an extended intermission is used between sets 2 and 3. Added NHIAA.

Version 2.2: Cleaned up the timer pause/resume feature and fixed the pause icon. For NCAA Women's volleyball, fixed the long-press of the down< button to vibrate when starting the Extended Intermission timer. It also doesn't wait for the button to be released. *** Version 2.1: Added pause/resume for the select button while the timer is running. For NCAA Women's volleyball, a long-press of the down button, for starting the "between sets" timer, will start a 10-minute Extended Intermission timer (with 3-minute horn warning) when an extended intermission is used between sets 2 and 3. Added NHIAA.

Version 2.1: Added pause/resume for the select button while the timer is running. For NCAA Women's volleyball, a long-press of the down button, for starting the "between sets" timer, will start a 10-minute Extended Intermission timer (with 3-minute horn warning) when an extended intermission is used between sets 2 and 3. Added NHIAA.
2.0.5: Changed default timeout time to 1:15 for MIAA and NCAA Women (per 2014-2015 rule change: NCAA 11.2.2). Bugfixes and code cleanup.

2.0.4: Combined NERVA Juniors into single entry and made warmup time selectable (7 or 10 minutes). Made the clock consistent with the scoresheet for the particular organization (12 or 24 hour format).
Version 2.0.3: Figured out the best way to maintain accuracy. Determine when timer starts relative to clock ticks and delay timer ticks from clock ticks.
Repeated 1-second timers was losing tiny amounts of time (which magnified the longer the timer ran). Changed to use the clock "seconds" timer to maintain accuracy.

data.description: Volleyball Referee Timer for Pebble Smartwatch aids volleyball referees in timing 3 things: warmups, timeouts, and the interval between sets. Since different rulesets use variations of these, it lets you choose the ruleset and lets you customize your timers for matches that you are refereeing. To ensure you never miss anything important, it will vibrate to alert you to upcoming actions.

- free play mode, try to get your top score in one single round

- qualify mode, a six-round challenging experience


How many balls will you be able to score without a miss?
Do your best!

data.author: James Fowler

changelog.release_notes: Consistent chart colours; better fault reporting; bugs quashed;
Sleep timebar, sun and moon bars
On watch charts now work even when the smart alarm has not been set
On the watch charts
Minor bug fix release
Snooze monitoring and #tweetMySleep
Automatic email export; Accelerometer error indicator; more prominent progress bar; Google analytics
Bug fix release
Timeline on Original Pebbles; Morpheuz Sleep Summary
Voice Control
* Support for Pebble Time Round

* The menu doesn't show "Ignore" until Morpheuz is recording sleep. 
* Better Smart Alarm dialog
* The smart alarm on/off is a separate menu item. 
* The smart alarm setting menu item shows the time range picked in the description.
* The menu closes after most options, except turning the smart alarm on or off, setting a new smart alarm time, or accessing the preset menu. The reasoning being that it is likely that another menu item will be picked after these ones. Use cases like set smart alarm times, then pick bed time. Or set times and store in preset memory.
* All watch face times now pay correct attention to 12hr or 24hr setting.
* The date on the tops of menus and the main screen includes the day of the week. Personally I really care this is Friday night....
* The IFTTT Maker interface now gets a 'morpheuz_bedtime' event too.
* The app starts faster on Pebble and Pebble Steel.
* Little notices to tell you to press "Bed time" don't appear whilst you are on the menu trying to press the "Bed time" option. This seemed rude.
* The times for the smart alarm can straddle midnight.
* A typo showing hyphens on the IFTTT maker events on the settings page has been fixed. Should be underscores.
* Alarm button markers appear when the alarm sounds. No more guessing which button to press.

Menu checkboxes are ticked or empty on b&w devices - makes it extra clear whether something is on. The red crosses and green ticks remain on the colour devices.
The auto bedtime now shows the time as 12/24 hour as selected.
Removed ‘weekend mode’. Removing functionality is something I very seldom ever do. I added this feature back in the days when the alarm was turned on and off from the phone at the same time as reset for bed was picked. It allowed 12 hours of ‘don’t bother with the alarm’ to be selected from the watch. However now the alarm can be turned on and off so easily with the pick of a menu item, it is simply confusing (the alarm is on, there are times shown on the screen, but the alarm is off right?). The only email correspondence I ever had on the feature expressed mild bemusement. There was even a message that was displayed if someone attempted to set weekend mode when the alarm was off.

Collapsing config sections on setting page. They are all shown initially collapsed to reduce the overall cluttered appearance.
* IFTTT Maker Channel support with 'morpheuz_data' and 'morpheuz_alarm' events.
* Record icon appears immediately 'bed time' is selected, rather than appearing, somewhat confusingly, after a minute.
* All the config sections have bullet point colours to correctly reflect the set status: grey (one-off export), blue (automatic but unset), green (automatic and set) and red (automatic and failed).
* Ensure that LIFX fadein time defaults to a reasonable 60 seconds.
* Automatically open the config sections on those exports/interfaces that have failed so as the reason why is shown immediately.
* Bug in menu introduced in 3.3 removed.

No background process. Morpheuz can now work happily with UP or Misfit. When these interrupt Morpheuz in order to sync their data, Morpheuz will, if it it monitoring sleep re-launch itself after 5 minutes. Morpheuz can easily co-exist with either of these or Battery+.
Phillips Hue light triggering on alarm. If the specified light is off, then it comes on at minimum brightness and brightens gently to maximum. If the light is already on Morpheuz leaves it unchanged.
Redesigned analogue face which is much easier to read. 
Battery bar goes orange and then red on low battery (Pebble Time).
Better version propagation (again).
LIFX Smartbulb handling should now work correctly.
Menu shows action just before closing, providing a more solid positive feedback.
Highlight color of menu and settings now black on Pebble Time. This provides more contrast and makes it easier to see and read.
Removed additional jqplot header from HTML - minor but probably unnoticeable performance improvement.
Included a chart hyperlink in the CSV export. Now see the chart again as well as read a copy of your data
Ignore line on plot now matches width of chart so appears to cover 10 minutes as it should.
Provided a "Test pushover/smartlight settings" checkbox on save on the configuration page. Makes it possible to test without waiting until morning.
The horizontal marks on the movement chart are now at the threshold between deep, light and restless sleep.

* Better graphics on Pebble Time
* Preset smart alarm times (3 independent memories) (sadly PT only due to application size)
* Battery gauge goes red when 10% or less power available (PT)
* Email export of CSV data now sends a pleasantly formatted HTML email rather than using "mailto:" which worked on iOS but seldom on Android. It takes a few seconds for confirmation on screen.
* Removed CSV copy area as the email export should now be usable on all platforms.
* Cancel alarm and snooze alarm now match the built in alarm button choices regardless of platform (PT has cancel on down and snooze on up - original pebble is visa-versa).
* The "notices" window can be cancelled by the press of any button.
* The 11 hour after bedtime wakeup for automatic exports shuts down as soon as they are done rather than leaving Morpheuz open for 5 minutes.
* The long press on the back button to leave Morpheuz (originally intended to prevent an accidental press stopping the app) is now only required when in "recording" mode or when power nap is running. Any other time a single press will shut the app, just like any other.

* Timeline with actions and quote of the day
* 10 hours recording
* LIFX light support
* Colour graph on Pebble Time on main screen
* Strap metrics replaced
* Some nomenclature changes - Reset is now 'Bed time'
Fixed timezone handling under Basalt (Pebble Time)
* Color and 3.0 support

* Version warning in settings page
* Copyright upgraded to 2015
* Full C to JS round trip app message ACK
* Better version number propogation
* Allow working builds without the file containing usage application key
* No longer stops the worker process on exit as this wrecked upgrades
* Settings page scales to size of phone
* Report view in pushover scales to size of phone and supports landscape
Improved icons; Export done icon; Last export date on settings page; Auto export timeout handling; Better auto export error handling; Anonymous usage statistics using www.straphq.com

data.description:
A Complete Sleep App For Pebble.

* Smart Alarm with Snooze
* Sleep Movement Charts
* Digital and Analogue Faces
* Voice Control
* Powernap
* Daily charts sent to Pushover
* Daily sleep time sent to Apple Health
* Email export of chart and basic data
* Phillips Hue & LIFX Smartbulb support (gently light your room up when the alarm goes off)
* IFTTT Integration (can be used with WeMo, automatic email export, PushBullet and/or anything else you can think of)
* Now compatible with Misfit and UP apps
* Automatic bed time
* Free
* Smart alarm memories - three presets for your favourite settings
* Timeline support showing alarm time and bed time
* Sleep quote of the day
* Actionable timeline pins: bed now & cancel bed time.
* Morpheuz Sleep Summary in the Timeline.

Documentation on morpheuz.net

If you like Morpheuz, then click the heart or make a small donation.

[Apple Health export requires Smartwatch Pro]

changelog.release_notes: 1.6 Works with Pebble 2
1.5 Initial support for round watch faces. Yes, I know most of them are still square faces. That will be fixed soon enough.
Colorizing watchfaces for Pebble Time has never been easier. Over a dozen carefully selected color palettes to choose from. Just long-select and press up or down to see all the variations.
1.3 Fixed a bug that could cause hourly vibrate to not turn off.

1.2 Bluetooth vibrate now respects vibration time range. Added Modern2 hour/minute hands (thickness swapped). Automatic version update compatibility. Fixed crash on quit that was in previous 1.2 build attempt.
1.1.7 Now with 27 watchfaces and bluetooth connection monitoring.
1.1.5 Personalized logos, 24 watchfaces.

data.description:
Over a dozen readable color palettes! 
27 watch faces, battery & BT vibrate! 
Up/down switches to the next watch face.
Change color with Long Select, then Up/Down. 
Long Up for battery %. 

All configurations done by pressing the Select button repeatedly till you see the feature you want to change. Then press up or down to change watch hands, watch logo, date formats, and vibrate mode. 

Like this app? Prove it! Please give it a heart!

Most backgrounds designed by Lukasz Zalewski. 

Check out my other apps for digital watchface swapping:  6 Watchfaces and 7 Watchfaces.

My transit Apps: My Bus, MY SF Bay Bus & Rail, My MTA Bus, My WMATA Bus & Rail, My Vancouver Bus.

And other apps: Food Trucks, SF Food Trucks and Any Time.
